column2: nobabyforme, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Very easy to use, only have to wait ten minutes after insertion prior to intercourse. Can be a bit messy afterwards due to spermicide dissolving. Overall is a very good contraceptive method compared to condoms or the pill.

column9: Horrible I will never use this again. The burning sensation afterwards is awful and extremely painful to urinate.  My husband also said he had some burning after.

column2: Joseph, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column9: I have been using the encare inserts for a little over 3 years now with the same partner. I have noticed the urethral burning/itching on rare occasion, but its not frequent. Its actually just irritation from the N-9 in encare getting into the urethra. Personally I would recommend taking a break from using encare and any other product containing N-9 or other spermicides if you experience this, just till it goes away (couple days). Other than that, It's a wonderful product, and after 3 years its been 100% effective. Speaking for the woman of my life though, she agrees that after a while it gets a little leaky. Wouldn't reccomend using it if your planning on going out somewhere afterwards as you may have a wet seat issue.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Tried this product for the first time tonight. sure it was easy enough to start using but, almost immediately upon intercourse it became very hot! After a brief interruption it it became extremely uncomfortable for both of us, so we stopped! Now there is extreme burning discomfort when using the bathroom(for us both)! surely that's not normal?

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I felt the burning sensation afterward as well. I used this product about 8 or 9 yrs ago, before having kids and do not recall having this problem. I also noticed the spotting, but I'm not sure if that is related to the product or not.

column2: india82, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I decided to get off birth control pills for health reasons and I've explored many vaginal suppository options and have found Encare to be the easiest to use. I have noticed a warm sensation during sex that is pleasurable, so it adds to mine and my fiance's intimacy. I'm just not sure if it's safe to use around my time of ovulation and if it will really help prevent pregnany at that time. But overall, if used correctly, I believe this is a very effective product. The discharge a couple of days afterwards, someone else mentioned is the body's way of releasing that spermicide. I think the women who say they have gotten pregnant off this product did not use it correctly, as there are always failure rates to any type of contraceptive if not used correctly.

column2: 19-24 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been using this for about 7 months and so far so good. My partner has had no complaints. It's easy to use and you don't have to wait too long. Only complaint is after 30 mins or so it starts to get leaky and messy. It does tend to burn sometimes, but i think that it's from irritation during sex. I also noticed sometimes i'll have light unusual spotting a day or two after using. Don't know if it's from the foam or something else. But all in all, it's not a bad product
